drugs.purpose: Lowers cholesterol and reduces the risk of heart disease.
drugs.usage: Take once daily with or without food. Follow the doctorâ€™s prescription strictly.
drugs.warning: May cause liver problems; avoid excessive alcohol consumption. Not recommended during pregnancy.

drugs.purpose: Used to manage type 2 diabetes by controlling blood sugar levels.
drugs.usage: Take with meals to reduce stomach upset. Follow the prescribed dosage strictly.
drugs.warning: May cause lactic acidosis in rare cases. Inform the doctor of kidney issues before use.

drugs.purpose: Treats high blood pressure and heart failure.
drugs.usage: Take once daily, with or without food. Maintain consistent usage time.
drugs.warning: Avoid use during pregnancy. May cause dizziness; get up slowly from sitting/lying positions.

drugs.purpose: Reduces stomach acid production to treat acid reflux and ulcers.
drugs.usage: Take before meals, usually once daily. Swallow capsules whole.
drugs.warning: Long-term use may increase fracture risk. Not recommended for immediate heartburn relief.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat anxiety and panic disorders.
drugs.usage: Take as prescribed, usually 2-3 times daily. Avoid abrupt discontinuation.
drugs.warning: May cause drowsiness and dependency. Avoid alcohol and operating heavy machinery.

drugs.purpose: Antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections.
drugs.usage: Take with or without food as directed. Complete full course of treatment.
drugs.warning: Do not use if allergic to penicillin. May cause diarrhea.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat bacterial infections including respiratory infections and STDs.
drugs.usage: Take once daily with or without food. Follow full prescription course.
drugs.warning: May cause stomach upset. Inform doctor if allergic to macrolides.

drugs.purpose: Diuretic used to treat high blood pressure and fluid retention.
drugs.usage: Take once daily, preferably in the morning.
drugs.warning: May cause dizziness and dehydration. Monitor potassium levels.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat hypothyroidism.
drugs.usage: Take once daily on an empty stomach, 30 minutes before breakfast.
drugs.warning: Do not switch brands without consulting a doctor. Overdose can cause serious side effects.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat high blood pressure and chest pain (angina).
drugs.usage: Take once daily with or without food.
drugs.warning: May cause swelling in the ankles and dizziness. Avoid grapefruit.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat depression, anxiety, and OCD.
drugs.usage: Take once daily with or without food.
drugs.warning: May cause drowsiness and nausea. Avoid alcohol and sudden discontinuation.

drugs.purpose: Treats high blood pressure and reduces stroke risk.
drugs.usage: Take once daily with or without food.
drugs.warning: Not safe during pregnancy. May cause dizziness.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat nerve pain and seizures.
drugs.usage: Take 2-3 times daily as prescribed.
drugs.warning: May cause dizziness and drowsiness. Avoid alcohol.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat inflammation and immune-related conditions.
drugs.usage: Take with food to prevent stomach upset.
drugs.warning: Long-term use may cause osteoporosis. Follow tapering schedule.

drugs.purpose: Prevents blood clots in heart disease and stroke patients.
drugs.usage: Take once daily with or without food.
drugs.warning: May increase bleeding risk. Inform doctor before surgery.

drugs.purpose: Used to relieve moderate to severe pain.
drugs.usage: Take as prescribed with or without food.
drugs.warning: May cause drowsiness and addiction. Avoid alcohol.

drugs.purpose: Treats depression, OCD, and anxiety disorders.
drugs.usage: Take once daily with or without food.
drugs.warning: May cause nausea and insomnia. Avoid abrupt discontinuation.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat bacterial infections.
drugs.usage: Take with or without food. Avoid dairy products.
drugs.warning: May cause tendon rupture. Avoid excessive sunlight.

drugs.purpose: Diuretic used to treat fluid retention and high blood pressure.
drugs.usage: Take in the morning to prevent nighttime urination.
drugs.warning: May cause dehydration and low potassium levels.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat enlarged prostate symptoms.
drugs.usage: Take 30 minutes after the same meal daily.
drugs.warning: May cause dizziness and fainting.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat depression and anxiety disorders.
drugs.usage: Take once daily with or without food.
drugs.warning: May cause drowsiness and sexual dysfunction.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat depression and anxiety disorders.
drugs.usage: Take with food to reduce stomach upset.
drugs.warning: May cause dizziness and increased blood pressure.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat depression and aid smoking cessation.
drugs.usage: Take as prescribed, with or without food.
drugs.warning: May increase seizure risk. Avoid alcohol.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat fluid retention and high blood pressure.
drugs.usage: Take once or twice daily as directed.
drugs.warning: May cause high potassium levels. Avoid potassium supplements.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat arthritis pain and inflammation.
drugs.usage: Take once daily with food.
drugs.warning: May increase risk of heart attack and stroke.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat anxiety and seizures.
drugs.usage: Take as prescribed, typically 2-3 times daily.
drugs.warning: May cause drowsiness and dependence. Avoid alcohol.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat depression and anxiety disorders.
drugs.usage: Take once daily at bedtime.
drugs.warning: May cause weight gain and drowsiness.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat bacterial infections and acne.
drugs.usage: Take with a full glass of water. Avoid lying down for 30 minutes after taking.
drugs.warning: May cause sun sensitivity. Avoid dairy and iron supplements.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat anxiety and allergic reactions.
drugs.usage: Take as prescribed, with or without food.
drugs.warning: May cause drowsiness. Avoid alcohol.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat high blood pressure and heart failure.
drugs.usage: Take with food to reduce the risk of dizziness.
drugs.warning: May cause low blood pressure and fatigue.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat depression, OCD, and anxiety disorders.
drugs.usage: Take once daily, usually in the morning.
drugs.warning: May cause drowsiness and sexual dysfunction.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat pain and inflammation.
drugs.usage: Take as prescribed, with or without food.
drugs.warning: May increase the risk of heart attack and stroke.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat high blood pressure and ADHD.
drugs.usage: Take as prescribed, usually once or twice daily.
drugs.warning: May cause drowsiness and dry mouth.

drugs.purpose: Prevents blood clots in patients with heart conditions.
drugs.usage: Take at the same time daily as directed.
drugs.warning: Avoid sudden changes in diet, especially green leafy vegetables.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat allergies.
drugs.usage: Take once daily, with or without food.
drugs.warning: Avoid fruit juices as they may reduce effectiveness.

drugs.purpose: Used to prevent blood clots and strokes.
drugs.usage: Take with food to improve absorption.
drugs.warning: May increase bleeding risk. Inform doctor before surgery.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat gout and kidney stones.
drugs.usage: Take after meals to reduce stomach upset.
drugs.warning: Stay hydrated to prevent kidney stone formation.

drugs.purpose: Used to relieve pain and inflammation.
drugs.usage: Take with food or milk to reduce stomach upset.
drugs.warning: Long-term use may increase risk of heart attack and stroke.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat acid reflux and ulcers.
drugs.usage: Take before meals as directed.
drugs.warning: Long-term use may reduce vitamin B12 absorption.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat ADHD and narcolepsy.
drugs.usage: Take in the morning to avoid insomnia.
drugs.warning: May be habit-forming. Avoid alcohol and caffeine.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat ADHD and narcolepsy.
drugs.usage: Take in the morning to avoid insomnia.
drugs.warning: May be habit-forming. Avoid alcohol and caffeine.

drugs.purpose: Used to reduce stomach acid and treat GERD.
drugs.usage: Take before meals as needed.
drugs.warning: May cause dizziness. Avoid long-term use without doctor consultation.

drugs.purpose: Prevents asthma and seasonal allergies.
drugs.usage: Take once daily in the evening.
drugs.warning: May cause mood changes and vivid dreams.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat high blood pressure and heart conditions.
drugs.usage: Take with or after food for better absorption.
drugs.warning: May cause fatigue and slow heart rate.

drugs.purpose: Reduces pain and fever.
drugs.usage: Take as needed, following dosage guidelines.
drugs.warning: Excessive use may cause liver damage.

drugs.purpose: Reduces pain, fever, and inflammation.
drugs.usage: Take with food to reduce stomach irritation.
drugs.warning: Long-term use may increase risk of stomach ulcers and kidney issues.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat depression, anxiety, and nerve pain.
drugs.usage: Take once daily with or without food.
drugs.warning: May cause dizziness and increased suicidal thoughts in young adults.

drugs.purpose: Used to treat depression and insomnia.
drugs.usage: Take with food, usually at bedtime.
drugs.warning: May cause drowsiness and dizziness.

drugs.purpose: Lowers cholesterol and reduces the risk of cardiovascular disease.
drugs.usage: Take once daily in the evening.
drugs.warning: Avoid grapefruit and excessive alcohol.

drugs.purpose: Relieves pain and reduces fever.
drugs.usage: Take as needed, following the dosage instructions on the label or as prescribed by a doctor. Do not exceed the recommended dose.
drugs.warning: Excessive use may cause liver damage. Avoid alcohol while taking this medication. Consult a doctor if pregnant or breastfeeding.

drugs.purpose: Prevents infection caused by the influenza virus.
drugs.usage: Administered annually via injection or nasal spray as recommended by healthcare providers.
drugs.warning: Mild side effects like soreness at the injection site or mild flu-like symptoms may occur. Consult a doctor if allergic to eggs or if you have a history of severe allergic reactions to vaccines.

drugs.generic_name: mRNA or Viral Vector COVID-19 Vaccine
drugs.purpose: Provides immunity against COVID-19 and reduces the risk of severe illness.
drugs.usage: Administered in one or more doses as per manufacturer guidelines. Booster doses may be required.
drugs.warning: Common side effects include fever, fatigue, and injection site pain. Severe allergic reactions are rare. Consult a doctor if you have a history of allergic reactions to vaccines.

drugs.purpose: Prevents infection caused by the hepatitis B virus (HBV).
drugs.usage: Administered in a series of 2-3 doses over 6 months, usually starting at birth.
drugs.warning: Side effects may include soreness at the injection site or mild fever. People with severe allergies to yeast should consult a doctor.

drugs.purpose: Provides immunity against measles, mumps, and rubella viruses.
drugs.usage: Given in two doses, typically in childhood (12-15 months and 4-6 years old).
drugs.warning: Mild rash or fever may occur. Avoid if pregnant or immunocompromised unless advised by a doctor.

drugs.purpose: Protects against tetanus, diphtheria, and pertussis (whooping cough).
drugs.usage: Recommended every 10 years as a booster, with an initial dose in adolescence or adulthood.
drugs.warning: Common side effects include redness or swelling at the injection site. Rare but severe allergic reactions may occur.

drugs.purpose: Prevents infections from human papillomavirus, which can cause cervical and other cancers.
drugs.usage: Given in 2-3 doses, typically recommended for adolescents before exposure to the virus.
drugs.warning: Mild pain, swelling, or dizziness may occur. Not recommended during pregnancy.

drugs.purpose: Provides immunity against the varicella-zoster virus, which causes chickenpox.
drugs.usage: Administered in two doses, typically in childhood (12-15 months and 4-6 years old).
drugs.warning: Mild rash or fever may occur. Avoid if pregnant or immunocompromised unless advised by a doctor.

drugs.purpose: Protects against pneumococcal bacteria that cause pneumonia, meningitis, and bloodstream infections.
drugs.usage: Recommended for young children, older adults, and individuals with certain medical conditions.
drugs.warning: Common side effects include soreness at the injection site, fever, and fatigue.

drugs.purpose: Prevents rotavirus infection, a leading cause of severe diarrhea in infants and young children.
drugs.usage: Given orally in two or three doses before the age of 8 months.
drugs.warning: Mild diarrhea or irritability may occur. Rare risk of intussusception (intestinal blockage).

drugs.purpose: Prevents meningococcal disease, which can cause meningitis and bloodstream infections.
drugs.usage: Recommemended for adolescents, college students, and travelers to high-risk areas.
drugs.warning: Side effects are usually mild, including pain at the injection site or mild fever.
